question: Two fly wheels are connected by a non-slipping belt as shown in the figure. <katex>$I_1=4~kg~m^2$</katex>, <katex>$r_1=20cm$</katex>, <katex>$I_2=20~kg~m^2$</katex> and <katex>$r_2=30cm$</katex>. A torque of 10 Nm is applied on the smaller wheel. Then match the entries of column I with appropriate entries of column II.
images/2025-phy-6-1.png
| | Column I | | Column II (Values in SI units) |
| (a) | Angular acceleration of smaller wheel | (i) | <katex>$\frac{5}{3}$</katex> |
| (b) | Torque on the larger wheel | (ii) | <katex>$\frac{100}{3}$</katex> |
| (c) | Angular acceleration of larger wheel | (iii) | <katex>$\frac{5}{2}$</katex> |
explanation: For smaller wheel: <katex>$\tau_1 = I_1 \alpha_1 \Rightarrow 10 = 4 \alpha_1 \Rightarrow \alpha_1 = 2.5 = \frac{5}{2}$</katex> rad/s². (Matches iii)
Since connected by non-slipping belt, tangential acceleration is same: <katex>$a = r_1 \alpha_1 = r_2 \alpha_2$</katex>
Torque on larger wheel: <katex>$\tau_2 = I_2 \alpha_2 = 20 \times \frac{5}{3} = \frac{100}{3}$</katex> Nm. (Matches ii)
Correct match: a-iii, b-ii, c-i. Wait, checking options.
Calculated: a -> iii (5/2), c -> i (5/3), b -> ii (100/3).
Order: a-iii, b-ii, c-i. This corresponds to Option 4.
